element.definition: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.
element.requirements: Precision is handled implicitly in almost all cases of measurement.

mapping.map: PQ.value, CO.value, MO.value, IVL.high or IVL.low depending on the value

element.comments: The implicit precision in the value should always be honored. Monetary values have their own rules for handling precision (refer to standard accounting text books).

element.definition: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.
element.requirements: Need a framework for handling measures where the value is <5ug/L or >400mg/L due to the limitations of measuring methodology.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If there is no comparator, then there is no modification of the value
element.comments: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because the comparator modifies the interpretation of the value significantly. If there is no comparator, then there is no modification of the value.

binding.description: How the Quantity should be understood and represented.

element.definition: A human-readable form of the unit.
element.requirements: There are many representations for units of measure and in many contexts, particular representations are fixed and required. I.e. mcg for micrograms.

element.definition: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.
element.requirements: Need to know the system that defines the coded form of the unit.
element.short: System that defines coded unit form

element.definition: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.
element.requirements: Need a computable form of the unit that is fixed across all forms. UCUM provides this for quantities, but SNOMED CT provides many units of interest.
element.comments: The preferred system is UCUM, but SNOMED CT can also be used (for customary units) or ISO 4217 for currency.  The context of use may additionally require a code from a particular system.
